thread.title: Injured Hokies QB Michael Brewer cleared to practice
thread.title_full: Injured Hokies QB Michael Brewer cleared to practice

title: Injured Hokies QB Michael Brewer cleared to practice
text:
Virginia Tech quarterback Michael Brewer, injured in opener, cleared to return to practice THE ASSOCIATED PRESS First Posted: October 05, 2015 - 9:21 pmLast Updated: October 05, 2015 - 9:21 pm We also have more stories about: (click the phrases to see a list) 
People: 

BLACKSBURG, Virginia — Virginia Tech quarterback Michael Brewer has been cleared to return to practice. 
Brewer broke his left collarbone in the Hokies' season-opening loss to No. 1 Ohio State on Sept. 7. He was originally expected to miss eight to 10 weeks. 
Trainer Mike Goforth says Brewer will wear a yellow non-contact jersey in practice and his progress will be closely monitored. 
His possible participation in Friday night's game against North Carolina State could be a game-time decision. 
Goforth says running back Marshawn Williams reinjured his left knee in practice on Sept. 29 and will miss the rest of the season. Williams had the knee surgically repaired in December. The Hokies expect Williams to make a complete recovery.
